review_blob: Good appearance thanks to the rich and lasting foam. Smells as one would expect, certainly appealing scent. The taste us by refreshing enough for my likings. Although the used spices seem in order, they are overruled too early by a slightly unpleasant bitterness.
Cloudy appearance with decent foam on top. Smoother than most others in this style. Not bitter. Thirst quencher.
Great appearance with perfect thick and stable foam. Hoppy aromas. The taste is as one would expect. I was not disappointed. High rating, definitely having this again!
The alu bottle is great. Beer itself had a good appearance with stable foam, and great hop notes. Palate was good and similar to other lagers.
beer_name: Base Camp In-Tents India Pale Lager

review_blob:
Aroma:
Sweet and hoppy, slightly floral

Appearance:
Nice colour (red/amber) but the lack of head was a disappointment. All the foam disappeared really quickly within seconds.

Taste:
Unique taste worth trying! Sweet and malty, followed by a coffee-ish and slight bitter aftertaste!

Palate:
Very good. What youd expect from the beer. Not too lingering. Mouthfeel is thin and dry, overall great!

Try this beer if you dont mind a new taste!

Pleasant aroma of flowery hops. The colour is perfect and the beer is very clear. Nice white head with good retention for this type of beer.

Taste is very smooth, and slightly sweet. Mild hoppy finish, although crisp enough, leaving a very mild bitter taste. Definitely a good beer, and far above the mainstream pale lagers.

Mouthfeel is as it should be, thin, dry, and not too long is aftertaste
Great IPA. Fantastic aromas. Somehow the hops seem to affect me besides the alcohol.

Not bad but very generic in its style compared to its European counterparts. Typical hefe weibier aroma which is good. I definitely did not note any banana in the taste, unlike for example Edelwei. Taste is closer to Paulaner than Franziskaner (for the weibeer fans). Has slight notes of bubblegum and a yeasty but pleasant taste. Aftertaste is slightly dry and could be better. Mouthfeel is as youd expect from a beer in this style. Carbonation is not very high and feels smoother than for example Pilsner. Id even say a little effervescent.
Sweet aroma. Succeeded in adding in a honeyish taste. Not a fan of the aftertaste, expected it to be more fresh or maybe even less dry. Overall quite smooth.
beer_name: Vancouver Island High Trail Honey Ale

review_blob: Tried it from bottle and tap. From bottle I was not fond of it, no pronounced tastes. When I had it from the tap it was MUCH bettter. A fresh and rich taste, with a good mouthfeel and tasteful appearance in the original glass. Would recommend from tap.

Rightful winner of European Beer Star 2014, category European Style Mild-Lager.

This beer distinguishes itself by the perfect balance between malt and hop taste. The taste is full enough for a pilsener (not too watery), but also smooth and not too bitter in the end. Although you certainly notice a smooth slightly bitter hop taste.

Good quality. Like the fact that it comes in a dark glass bottle, in contrary to many other mass production beers. Feel that this will keep the beer from developing taste deviations.

You will like this beer if you like smooth pilseners, that still have some character to it. You might not like it so much if you do not like hop taste, or prefer a very strong bitter aftertaste.

Beer rated in comparison to other beers in this style.
Smooth and unique beer. Fresh and full taste, but lacks at the finish. Best Canadian witbier I have tried so far.

The aroma gives the false impression of a stale taste. However when you drink, this changes quickly. This beer is extremely fresh and smooth: citrus and herbs. It also has a yeasty taste to it. Very smooth. 

Would advice this to Belgian white fans.

Very fresh taste, perfect on a hot summer day. Citrus aromas, combined with a smooth slightly malty taste. The finish is outstanding, with several fresh tastes combined.

Appearance is not perfect due to a lack of foam. However, aroma is very good and taste as well. Hard to find a Belgian style witbier this good.

This beer has hints of banana, and has a yeasty taste. Its taste is complex enough, although very smooth. Carbonation is good for this beer type. Very close to Paulaner hefe-weizen (could not decide which one I prefer).
Swirled and poured out yeast.

Would recommend this to all people who like wheat beer.

This beer is close to perfection. Very fresh and full taste (also complex enough, not a boring beer), exactly the right amount of carbonation for this type, and a very tasty appearance in the official glass. Tried this beer often from bottle (in official glass), also at Oktoberfest Mnchen. Never disappoints. 


Contains subtle hints of banana, however not as much as for example Edelweiss.

Very close to Weihenstephaner hefe weibier. I have compared the two several times, and it is hard to decide which one is best. Swirled and poured the yeist out in the glass (for both beers). I do know know if you are supposed to, but I think it makes the taste more full.
